Package camzup.core

Class Bounds2

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Bounds2
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<Bounds2>
public class Bounds2 extends Object implements Comparable<Bounds2>
An axis aligned bounding box (AABB) for a 2D area, represented with a minimum and maximum coordinate.

  • Field Summary

    verify()
    Verifies that all components of minimum are less than those of the maximum, and that the minimums and maximums do not equal each other.

    • contains

      public static boolean contains(Bounds2 b, Vec2 v)
      Evaluates whether a point is within the bounding area, lower bounds inclusive, upper bounds exclusive. For cases where multiple bounds must cover an area without overlap or gaps.
      Parameters:
      b - the bounds
      v - the vector
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • contains

      public static Vec2 contains(Bounds2 b, Vec2 v, Vec2 target)
      Evaluates whether a point is within the bounding area, lower bounds inclusive upper bounds exclusive. For cases where multiple bounds must cover an area without overlap or gaps.

      A boolean vector is returned; useful for cases where a point may be contained in one dimension but not in another.
      Parameters:
      b - the bounds
      v - the vector
      target - the output vector
      Returns:
      the evaluation

      v - the point
      Returns:
      the evaluation

    • split

      public static void split(Bounds2 b, Bounds2 sw, Bounds2 se, Bounds2 nw, Bounds2 ne)
      Splits a bounding area into quadrants.
      Parameters:
      b - the bounds
      sw - south west target bounds
      se - south east target bounds
      nw - north west target bounds
      ne - north east target bounds
      See Also:
      • split(Bounds2, float, float, Bounds2, Bounds2, Bounds2, Bounds2)

    • split

      public static void split(Bounds2 b, float xFac, float yFac, Bounds2 sw, Bounds2 se, Bounds2 nw, Bounds2 ne)
      Splits a bounding area into four quadrants according to two factors in [0.0, 1.0] . The factor on the x axis governs the vertical split; on the y axis, the horizontal split.
      Parameters:
      b - bounds
      xFac - vertical factor
      yFac - horizontal factor
      sw - south west target bounds
      se - south east target bounds
      nw - north west target bounds
      ne - north east target bounds
      See Also:
      • Utils.clamp(float, float, float)

    • split

      public static boolean split(Bounds2 b, Vec2 v, Bounds2 sw, Bounds2 se, Bounds2 nw, Bounds2 ne)
      Splits a bounding area into four quadrants according to a point. If the point is inside the bounding area, assigns the result to target bounds and returns true. If the point is outside the bounding area, returns false.
      Parameters:
      b - the bounds
      v - the point
      sw - south west target bounds
      se - south east target bounds
      nw - north west target bounds
      ne - north east target bounds
      Returns:
      point is in bounds
      See Also:
      • Utils.div(float, float)
      • split(Bounds2, float, float, Bounds2, Bounds2, Bounds2, Bounds2)

      Returns:
      the unit square
